page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
These cupmarks suggest that originally it had some association with a primitive form of worship.On the northern face,seven inches from the top is the inscription "PERRON DU ROY".Below these letters are other letters which are believed to have been cut somewhere around 1720.
Besides the perron du roi, there was supposed to be another menhir which stood by the Gouffre and was probably a statue menhir,representing the earth goddess.Because of its associations with pagan worship,the area was thought to be haunted by werewolves, (the road name "Variouf" tells us this ).As well as the werewolves and the menhirs,the area was patrolled by a dog of death (a legendary guardian of pagan stones and tombs).
